definition: not to feel like (doing sth)/disinclined to
lazy
variant of 懶|懒[lan3]
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to
not wishing to acknowledge sb/unwilling to respond

sentences.english: Needless to say, the British made no attempt to introduce anti-racist legislation.
sentences.chinese: 不用说，英国人是懒得在香港对反种族主义立法的。

sentences.english: Even I don't feel like moving my hand which holds the mouse.
sentences.chinese: 甚至握着鼠标的手都懒得挪一下位置。

sentences.english: Multicasting requires some more coding and programmers are lazy to even look into it.
sentences.chinese: 多播需求更多甚至连程序员都懒得浏览检验的代码。

sentences.english: Lying in a den in Bombay , with a slack jaw and not much to say.
sentences.chinese: 躺在孟买的一个密室里，下巴都懒得动，不想说什么。

sentences.english: Why, I'm that tired Sunday I can't even read the papers.
sentences.chinese: 唉，星期天我可是疲倦得要命，连报都懒得看的。

sentences.english: Larry is too lazy to lift a finger.
sentences.chinese: 拉里懒得不想动指头去帮任何人。

sentences.english: He is too lazy to move but luckily he has strong toes.
sentences.chinese: 他虽然懒得不肯动，但是幸而有强壮的脚趾。

sentences.english: The main influencing factors for perceived barriers to exercise include laziness and lack of time.
sentences.chinese: 自觉运动障碍最大因素为懒得动和时问不够。

sentences.english: She walked into my room without bothering to ring the bell first.
sentences.chinese: 她连先按下门铃都懒得按一下就走进了我的房间。

sentences.english: Larry is too lazy to lift a finger to help anybody.
sentences.chinese: 拉里懒得不想动指头去帮助任何人。

sentences.english: I was too tired to think about it more so I just glanced at it and fell asleep.
sentences.chinese: 一路累乏，懒得多想，只看了它一眼，倒头便睡。

sentences.english: And you'd rather spend an extra ten minutes in a hot shower than go out for a morning job.
sentences.chinese: 相信你宁愿多花十分钟冲热水澡也懒得出门工作。

sentences.english: Some candidates don'tto spell the company's name correctly.
sentences.chinese: 一些应聘者都懒得把公司的名称拼写正确。

sentences.english: I sent them an invitation, but they didn't even bother to reply.
sentences.chinese: 我给他们寄了个请帖，但他们竟连话也懒得回。

sentences.english: You don't feel like leaving comments? Please leave your palm-print.
sentences.chinese: 懒得留言？那留下您的掌印吧。

sentences.english: Like I said, I've been feeling lazy.
sentences.chinese: 就像我说的，我觉得懒得动。

definition: unexpectedly
lazy
variant of 懶|懒[lan3]
nonsense/rubbish/superfluous words/You don't say!/No kidding! (gently sarcastic)
you might as well (do it)/simply/just
variant of 答理[da1 li5]
useless
straightforward/clear-cut/blunt (e.g. statement)/you might as well/simply
at a loss/unable to do anything about it/to have no choice
need not
there is nothing to be done/one can't do anything about it
to understand/to pay attention to/to take notice of
to argue needlessly/to waste time explaining
to refuse to acknowledge/to pay no attention to/to take no notice of/to ignore
to pay no attention to/not to mind
never
not very/not particularly
